How this API documentation is organized

This API (application programming interface) documentation contains pages that correspond to the items in the navigation bar, as described below.

  • Overview

    Overview The page is the homepage of this API documentation, providing a list of all packages and their overviews. This page may also contain an overall description of these packages.

  • Program package

    Each package has a page that contains a list of its classes and interfaces and their summary. These pages can contain six categories:

    • Interface
    • Class
    • enumerate
    • Abnormal error
    • error
    • Annotation Type

  • Class or Interface

    Each class, interface, nested class, and nested interface has its own page. Each page consists of three parts (class/interface description, summary table, and detailed member description):

    • Class inheritance diagram
    • Direct subclass
    • All known subinterfaces
    • All known implementation classes
    • Class or interface declaration
    • Class or interface description

    • Nested Class Overview
    • Field Overview
    • Property Summary
    • Constructor Overview
    • Method Summary

    • Field Details
    • Property details
    • Constructor Details
    • Method Details

    Each summary entry contains the first sentence of the detailed description of that item. Summary entries are arranged alphabetically, while detailed descriptions are arranged in the order in which they appear in the source code. This preserves the logical groupings established by the programmer.

  • Annotation Type

    Each annotation type has its own page with the following sections:

    • Annotation type declaration
    • Annotation Type Description
    • Summary of Required Elements
    • Optional Elements Summary
    • Element Details

  • enumerate

    Each enumeration has its own page with the following sections:

    • Enumeration declaration
    • Enumeration Description
    • Enumeration Constants Summary
    • Enumeration constant details

  • All classes

    All classesLinks are shown for all classes and interfaces (except non-static nested types).

  • Serialized Form

    Every serializable or externalizable class has a description of its serialized fields and methods. This information is useful to re-implementers and less useful to developers using the API. Although there is no link in the navigation bar, you can get this information by going to any serialization class and clicking "Serialization Form" in the "See Also" section of the class description.

  • Constant field value

    Constant field valueThe page lists the static final fields and their values.

  • Search

    Definitions of modules, packages, types, fields, methods, and other terms defined in the API can be searched using partial or full names. "CamelCase" abbreviations are supported: for example, "InpStr" will find "InputStream" and "InputStreamReader".

This help file is for API documentation generated by the standard doclet.
